name: Howling Banshee
text:
Flying
When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.

name: Howling Chorus
text:
Creatures with power less than Howling Chorus's power can't block it.
Whenever Howling Chorus deals combat damage to a player, create a 3/2 colorless Eldrazi Horror creature token.

name: Howling Fury
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.
I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

name: Howling Gale
text:
Howling Gale deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Howling Mine
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

editions.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.
The mine's riches never end, nor do the moans of the spirits doomed to haunt them.

name: Howling Wolf
text: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Howl of the Horde
text:
When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Raid — If you attacked with a creature this turn, when you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell an additional time. You may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Howl of the Night Pack
text: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each Forest you control.

editions.flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.
The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.
The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

name: Howlpack Alpha
text:
Each other creature you control that's a Werewolf or a Wolf gets +1/+1.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack Alpha.

name: Howlpack of Estwald
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack of Estwald.

editions.flavor: Estwald's citizens don't dislike outsiders—they taste just fine.

name: Howlpack Resurgence
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Each creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +1/+1 and has trample.

editions.flavor: The renewed howling of werewolves announced the end of the Cursemute—and the beginning of Avacyn's madness.

name: Howlpack Wolf
text: Howlpack Wolf can't block unless you control another Wolf or Werewolf.

editions.flavor: Wolves and werewolves join together for the common cause of the hunt.

name: Howltooth Hollow
text:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{B}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if each player has no cards in hand.

name: Huang Zhong, Shu General
text: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.

editions.flavor:
"Virile in war, he kept the north in fear;
His prodigies subdued the western sphere."

name: Hua Tuo, Honored Physician
text: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Hubris
text: Return target creature and all Auras attached to it to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor:
"You wish to learn of Nyx? Very well."
—Phenax, god of deception

name: Hulking Cyclops
text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.

editions.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

—Afari, Tales

name: Hulking Goblin
text: Hulking Goblin can't block.

editions.flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.
The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.
The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

name: Hulking Ogre
text: Hulking Ogre can't block.

editions.flavor:
"The Keldons' ogre campaign provided more body parts than my meager facility could properly use."
—Gatha, Tolarian renegade
Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.

name: Hull Breach
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.

name: Human Frailty
text: Destroy target Human creature.

editions.flavor:
"I have seen a hundred mortal families rise and fall. I shall outlast a thousand more."
—Olivia Voldaren

"I have seen a hundred mortal families rise and fall. I shall outlast a thousand more."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Humble
text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and has base power and toughness 0/1.

editions.flavor: Through failure we learn our finest lessons in humility.

"It is not your place to rule, Radiant. It may not even be mine."
—Serra

name: Humble Budoka
text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Each time wanderers entered the forest seeking enlightenment, Dosan was there, waiting for them to arrive.

name: Humble Defector
text: {T}: Draw two cards. Target opponent gains control of Humble Defector. Activate this ability only during your turn.

editions.flavor:
"You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

"You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."
—Houn, Jeskai elder

name: Humbler of Mortals
text: Constellation — Whenever Humbler of Mortals or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The anger of the gods multiplied in Nyx, and the land awoke in dark echoes of their rage.

name: Humble the Brute
text:
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor: "The element of surprise only works when it's backed up by a bolt between the eyes."

name: Humility
text: All creatures lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.

editions.flavor:
"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem

"One cannot cleanse the wounds of failure."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Hum of the Radix
text: Each artifact spell costs {1} more to cast for each artifact its controller controls.

editions.flavor: The elves learned long ago that anything left here slowly vanishes. Now it is a sacred site where the dead are laid to rest and where unnatural magic is erased forever.

name: Hunding Gjornersen
text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

editions.flavor: "You would never guess, at the terrifying sight of the man, that Hunding was as charming a companion as one could wish for."
"You would never guess, at the terrifying sight of the man, that Hunding was as charming a companion as one could wish for."

name: Hundred-Handed One
text:
Vigilance
{3}{W}{W}{W}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
As long as Hundred-Handed One is monstrous, it has reach and can block an additional ninety-nine creatures each combat.

text:
Flying
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Hundroog
text: Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor:
"New links are being added to the food chain on a daily basis."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Hungering Yeti
text: As long as you control a green or blue permanent, you may cast Hungering Yeti as though it had flash. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)

editions.flavor: No clan is as adept at saying "go away" as the Temur.

name: Hunger of the Howlpack
text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

name: Hunger of the Nim
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each artifact you control.

editions.flavor: Their pain is so great, they can't help but share it with others.

name: Hungry Flames
text: Hungry Flames deals 3 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: In the hold of the Heart of Kiran, Chandra answered Dovin Baan's sabotage with an explosive retort.

name: Hungry Hungry Heifer
text: During your upkeep, remove a counter from any card you control or sacrifice Hungry Hungry Heifer.

editions.flavor: Mooo.

name: Hungry Mist
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.

editions.flavor:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."
—Murat, Death Speaker

"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."
—Murat, death speaker

"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow priestess

name: Hungry Spriggan
text:
Trample
Whenever Hungry Spriggan attacks, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: If a spriggan's eyes are larger than its stomach, it has ways to remedy the situation.

name: Hunt Down
text: Target creature blocks target creature this turn if able.

editions.flavor: "Springjacks and faeries can be difficult to hunt, but my favorite prey are the flamekin. They never fail to put up a worthy fight when cornered."

name: Hunted Dragon
text:
Flying, haste
When Hunted Dragon enters the battlefield, target opponent creates three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with first strike.

editions.flavor: The knights see a mighty quarry. The dragon sees breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
The knights see a mighty quarry. The dragon sees breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

name: Hunted Ghoul
text: Hunted Ghoul can't block Humans.

editions.flavor: Even after Hanweir was saved, Gisa's lost ghouls would shamble through, still following the twisted orders of their imprisoned master.

name: Hunted Horror
text:
Trample
When Hunted Horror enters the battlefield, target opponent creates two 3/3 green Centaur creature tokens with protection from black.

name: Hunted Lammasu
text:
Flying
When Hunted Lammasu enters the battlefield, target opponent creates a 4/4 black Horror creature token.

editions.flavor: The lammasu ruled the velds before the city grew. Now they roam Ravnica's skies, but their ancient enemies have not forgotten them.

name: Hunted Phantasm
text:
Hunted Phantasm can't be blocked.
When Hunted Phantasm enters the battlefield, target opponent creates five 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

name: Hunted Troll
text:
When Hunted Troll enters the battlefield, target opponent creates four 1/1 blue Faerie creature tokens with flying.
{G}: Regenerate Hunted Troll.

name: Hunted Wumpus
text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

name: Hunter of Eyeblights
text:
When Hunter of Eyeblights enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you don't control.
{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with a counter on it.

editions.flavor: Snokk ran as fast as he could, but the sound of hooves grew ever louder in his ears.

name: Hunter's Ambush
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by nongreen creatures this turn.

editions.flavor: First you lose your enemy's trail. Then you lose all sense of direction. Then you hear the growls . . .

name: Hunters' Feast
text: Any number of target players each gain 6 life.

editions.flavor: Those who kill a jawspur rhino must prepare spells to lift the carcass—even a dozen hunters can't lift its bulk.

name: Hunter's Insight
text: Choose target creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player or planeswalker this turn, draw that many cards.

editions.flavor:
"The predator knows the true way of the world. Life is conflict. Only the strong survive."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Hunter Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have provoke. (Whenever a Sliver attacks, its controller may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)

editions.flavor: Once they get the scent, there is no escape.

name: Hunter's Prowess
text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample and "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw that many cards."

editions.flavor: To be counted among the warriors of Setessa's Leina Tower, you must not fear death, only failure.

name: Hunting Cheetah
text: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

name: Hunting Drake
text:
Flying
When Hunting Drake enters the battlefield, put target red or green creature on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Even the fiercest beast will flee when faced with the possibility of becoming dinner.

name: Hunting Grounds
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Hunting Grounds has "Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield."

editions.flavor: In the heavy hush of Krosa, drawing on mana is like ringing a dinner bell.

name: Hunting Kavu
text: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Exile Hunting Kavu and target creature without flying that's attacking you.

editions.flavor: Dominarians gladly fought alongside kavu . . . until the kavu figured out some Dominarians were quite tasty.

name: Hunting Moa
text:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Hunting Moa enters the battlefield or dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Hunting Pack
text:
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

name: Hunting Triad
text:
Create three 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens.
Reinforce 3—{3}{G} ({3}{G}, Discard this card: Put three +1/+1 counters on target creature.)

editions.flavor: "Eyeblights are easy to track. Just follow the imperfections."
"Eyeblights are easy to track. Just follow the imperfections."

name: Hunting Wilds
text:
Kicker {3}{G} (You may pay an additional {3}{G} as you cast this spell.)
Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
If Hunting Wilds was kicked, untap all Forests put onto the battlefield this way. They become 3/3 green creatures with haste that are still lands.

name: Huntmaster of the Fells
text:
Whenever this creature enters the battlefield or transforms into Huntmaster of the Fells, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token and you gain 2 life.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Huntmaster of the Fells.

name: Hunt the Hunter
text: Target green creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. It fights target green creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor:
"A grudge is a tattoo worn on the inside."
—Setessan warrior saying

name: Hunt the Weak
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

editions.flavor: Natural evolution is often at odds with industrial progress.
He who hesitates is lunch.
He who hesitates is lunch.
Dragons scorn the weak, even among their own kind.

name: Hurkyl's Recall
text: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.

editions.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

name: Hymn to Tourach

name: Hypergenesis
text:
Suspend 3—{1}{G}{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {1}{G}{G} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Starting with you, each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Repeat this process until no one puts a card onto the battlefield.

name: Hyperion Blacksmith
text: {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: "The smith a mighty man is he/ With large and sinewy hands./ And the muscles of his brawny arms/ Are strong as iron bands." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, The Village Blacksmith

name: Hypersonic Dragon
text:
Flying, haste
You may cast sorcery spells as though they had flash. (You may cast them any time you could cast an instant.)

editions.flavor:
"Even this primitive specimen of my kind is impressive."
—Niv-Mizzet

"Even this primitive specimen of my kind is impressive."
—Niv-Mizzet

name: Hypervolt Grasp
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
{1}{U}: Return Hypervolt Grasp to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Zap on. Zap off.

name: Hypnotic Cloud
text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Target player discards a card. If Hypnotic Cloud was kicked, that player discards three cards instead.

name: Hypnotic Siren
text:
Bestow {5}{U}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flying
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.

name: Hypnotic Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

name: Hypnox
text:
Flying
When Hypnox enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, exile all cards from target opponent's hand.
When Hypnox leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owner's hand.

name: Hypochondria
text:
{W}, Discard a card: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{W}, Sacrifice Hypochondria: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Hysterical Blindness
text: Creatures your opponents control get -4/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The panic is amusing, but the real fun comes when the spell passes and the villagers start looking for a scapegoat."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
